snippet: Among properties owned by the City of New York are lots so irregularly shaped or poorly situated that they are notable not for their value but for their peculiarity.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column notes that there are lots among properties owned by New York City that are so irregularly shaped or poorly situated that they are notable not for their value but for their peculiarity; one such lot, in Murray Hill section of Queens, is 500 feet long, 3 feet wide, and runs down the middle of a block of homes, through nearly two dozen backyards.
lead_paragraph: Among properties owned by the City of New York are lots so irregularly shaped or poorly situated that they are notable not for their value but for their peculiarity.

headline.main: For Sale in Queens: A Ribbon of Land, Three Feet Wide
headline.print_headline: For Sale in Queens: A Ribbon of Land, Three Feet Wide
